desc.p: Defines the COUNTRY and/or the COUNTRY.GROUP(s) where if the ordering customer is NOT resident then the commission WILL be applied. This field allows you to relate the commission to customers non-resident in specific countries, or groups of countries. If the ordering customer is resident in one of the countries defined here then this commission will not be applied. If RESIDENCY and NON.RESIDENCY are blank then the commission will be applied.

6 alphanumeric characters. Input must be in the format: XX where XX is a valid code on the COUNTRY file. or *ZZZZ where ZZZZ is a valid code on the COUNTRY.GROUP file.

Specifies whether the commission amount is to be calculated on a percentage basis, as a unit, or as a rate per lot basis. A unit charge can only be specified when using LEVEL or BAND calculation types. The amount entered in the UNIT.CHARGE field will applied for the corresponding amount in accordance with the BAND/LEVEL calculation type. A rate per lot charge can only be specified when using LOT calculation types. The value entered in the UNIT.CHARGE field will be applied for the corresponding amount per lot. This applies only for Derivatives trades.
Validation Rules
PERCENTAGE or UNIT or RATEPERLOT [Mandatory with CALC.TYPE of BAND or LEVEL or LOT, not allowed if CALC.TYPE is FLAT]

Determines whether the Commission Type is to be applied only when Foreign Exchange conversion is required. (Currency Conversion Dependent indicator). The presence of this field (only allowed value 'Y' for Yes) indicates that the derived commission amount is only to be applied when the associated Funds Transfer transaction entails a FX conversion (i.e. the Debit and Credit Currencies are different).
Validation Rules
Y(es) or blank. (Optional input)

Defines the Overall Minimum Percentage or rate to be charged on transfers involving the Currency defined. This represents the minimum to be charged irrespective of any special conditions which could exist for a Customer or group of Customers except if these have been specified as a Flat amount. Specifies the rate used to calculate the Commission for an entry as a Percentage of its value. This amount could represent the actual cost to the bank of providing the service, which should never be waived. Available Options for input: (1) Up to 10 type R characters plus a decimal point, (standard rate format.) but must be less than 100%. (2) Rate input must be positive and less than 100%. (3) Not more than 3 integers may be entered. (4) Not more than 9 decimals may be entered.

: (1) It must be less than the Overall Maximum Percentage. (2) If Flat amount entered, then Overall Minimum Percentage will not be allowed. The method of calculation to be used for the associated currency. This field specifies whether separate calculations are to be made for each band of the base amount, whether only one is calculated which is dependent on the level of the base amount, or whether a Flat amount is to be applied. Example for FLAT, LEVEL and BAND: Assume a deal of Principal 100,000 USD where commission is calculated based on the Principal. The commission type record specifies an applicable rate of 2 per cent up to 10,000 and 1.5 percent over 10,000. If Band is specified for all sub value groups, 2 calculations will be performed, i.e. 2% on 10,000 1.5% on 90,000 If Level is specified for all sub value groups, 1 calculation will be performed, ie. 1.5% on 100,000 If Flat is specified, the basic Flat Amount will be applied. For LOT: To be used with derivatives trades which perform charge calculations on per lot basis. If Lot is specified, the Unit Charge will be applied per lot traded
Validation Rules
FLAT, LEVEL, BAND or LOT or any abbreviation thereof. (Mandatory Input)

Defines the number of months that comprise a charging period. A charge may be made periodically, e.g monthly, quarterly, etc. This field determines he length of time for which the commission type record applies. The period of the contract will be split in the number of periods defined in this field to calculate the total commission amount, for example a contract lasting one year, with CHARGE.PERIOD set to 3, would incur 4 times the defined commission amount, since the period has been defined as quarterly. The corresponding field MINIMUM.PERIOD can be used to specify the minimum number of periods to be considered. Note that this is currently utilised only by the Trade Finance system.
Validation Rules
1, 3, 6, 9, 12 or 24 Optional Input

Defines the minimum number of months which comprise the smallest allowable charging period, used in conjunction with the CHARGE.PERIOD defined. The minimum period may be defined as monthly, quarterly, half-yearly, nine-monthly, annually, or bi-annually. The contract period will be divided into a number of charging periods as defined in CHARGE.PERIOD. This will then be compared against the MINIMUM.PERIOD, if the the minimum period yields a large value, this will be used to calculate the final chargeable amount. Currently only used in the Trade Finance module.
Validation Rules

Identifies the Tax record, or the TAX.TYPE.CONDITION record which specifies the tax calculation and processing applicable to the Commission Type. This Tax Code, or Tax Type grouping would be applicable to countries where banking services are subject to local taxes (e.g. VAT). The Application will then calculate taxes on the Charge according to the Tax Rate defined in the Tax table. The Tax Code used in this field is passed to Delivery as a suffix to the tax code TAX. This combined code will be used within Delivery to provide meaningful text for credit/debit advices. Note : The entry in the Tax table should only contain one rate because multiple tax rate codes will not be allowed within the Funds Transfer main program when the User processes a transaction. If a Tax Type Condition Identifier is specified, the system will derive the applicable TAX.CODE from the TAX.TYPE.CONDITION based on the customer grouping.
Validation Rules
Tax Code must be a valid code on the Tax table.

A valid info basic routine can be specified in this field to define the charging mechanism. When charge routine is present , any other charging mechanism defined in the record is ignored. The routine has eleven parameters - ten input parameters and one output parameters . The ten input parameters are same as that of CALCULATE.CHARGE ( see user guide for details) The output parameter is the CHARGE.AMOUNT. The charge amount is in account currency . The fields 37 to 47 in T.DATA , can be used by the charge calculation routine to return values to the calling apllication.
Validation Rules
The info basic routine should be prefixed with '@' .

Defines the Currency of any amounts input in the associated fields. Commissions must be specified in default or local currency and if special Commissions are to be applicable to different Currencies (e.g. different percentages/minimums/maximums) then Commissions must also be specified for each applicable Currency. The rules which determine which Currency (Credit or Debit) is initially used to identify the Commission Currency, are as follows:- For inward payments - Currency of the Debit. For all other payments - Currency of the Credit. If a specific Currency is not represented within the multivalue set, the System will default to the details associated to the default currency. If default currency is not defined then the local currency details will be used. The Currency equivalent amount will be derived at the currency table middle rate. If a default currency is defined then the default currency commission definition is mandatory, otherwise the local currency definition is mandatory.
Validation Rules
3 type SSS (uppercase alpha) character or 1-3 numeric character Currency code. Associated multivalue field. (Mandatory input for default currency if present, otherwise mandatory for local currency.)

COMMISSION.TYPE

Identifies this Commission Type. When defining the Commission ID by means of an alpha key, the User must try to use meaningful codes to facilitate easy identification of the Commission Type. Examples could be: PM = Payment Commission EX = Exchange Commission The codes defined in this field are passed to Delivery as a suffix to the Commission code FTCOM. The combined code will be used within Delivery to provide meaningful text for credit/debit advices. Commissions can be linked together by using an ID in the format XXXXX.YYYYY. All codes with the prefix XXXXXX will be 'linked'. Consequently when ANY commission code with the prefix XXXXX is used all linked records will also be processed. This is primarily used for defining different commissions for resident and non-resident customers. e.g. Codes Amounts Residence/Non residence HC 5.00 resident *EEC HC.NEEC 10.00 non-resident *EEC When either HC or HC.NEEC is used both will be examined and the correct commission calculated based on the residence of the ordering customer. NOTE : A linked record cannot be input without a corresponding master record, i.e. XXXXX.YYYYY cannot exist without commission code XXXXX. Commissions can be entered for future dates by using an ID in the format XXXXX.YYYYY-YYYYMMDD. All codes with a suffix in the above date format separated by the delimiter '-' are for future commission changes. Only future dated existing commission types can be entered in the above format.
Validation Rules

Defines the Overall Maximum Amount to be charged on transfers involving the Currency defined. This amount represents the maximum to be charged irrespective of any special conditions which could exist for a Customer or group of Customers except if these have been specified as a Flat amount. This amount could represent the maximum amount the bank would ever conceivably charge a customer for a transfer regardless of the size of the Transfer Amount. Example : Let us suppose that "Wonder Bank" based in London applies the following payment commissions on incoming and outgoing funds transfers: 1) For any transfer in US Dollars (received or paid): - 2% for any amount up to USD 20,000.00 with a minimum of $50.00 and a maximum of $400.00. - 1% for any amount above USD 20,000.00 with a minimum of $400.00 and a maximum of $2,000.00. - An overall minimum of $50.00 and overall maximum of $2,000.00. 2) For transfers in any other currencies: - 1% for any amount up to GBP 10,000.00 equivalent with a minimum of 20.00 and a maximum of 100.00 - 1/4% for any amount above GBP 10,000.00 with a minimum of 100.00 and a maximum of 500.00. - An overall minimum of 20.00 and overall maximum of 500.00. The following input will then be made in this table. Field Name Field Input Common CALC TYPE Band Currency GBP Flat Amount Percentage 1% UPTO Amount 10,000.00 Minimum Amount 20.00 Maximum Amount 100.00 Percentage 1/4% Upto Amount Minimum Amount 100.00 Maximum Amount 500.00 Overall Minimum Amount 20.00 Overall Maximum Amount 500.00 Currency USD Flat Amount Percentage 2% Upto Amount 20,000.00 Minimum Amount 50.00 Maximum Amount 400.00 Percentage 1% Upto Amount Minimum Amount 400.00 Maximum Amount 2,000.00 Overall Minimum Amount 50.00 Overall Maximum Amount 2,000.00

This field defines the Transaction code which will be assigned to the Credit Commission entry, generated (as a result of using this Commission Type) in the Profit and Loss Category code or internal account as specified in Category/Account field. Note : For Commission calculated on Foreign Exchange contracts, this code is also used in the debit entry.
Validation Rules

1-3 numeric character Transaction code. (Mandatory input.) Any Transaction code where DATA.CAPTURE has been defined with 'Y' will be refused. Transaction codes with the DEBIT.CREDIT.IND = to 'DEBIT' will not be allowed.
TXN.CODE.DR

Defines the (optional) transaction code to be used on the debit entry generated by the application for this Commission Type. This field defines the default transaction code which will be assigned to the debit entry to the account bearing the commission. However, the application may assign its own transaction code if for example the transaction is debit plus commissions or the commissions are consolidated before posting.
Validation Rules

1-3 numeric character Transaction code. (Mandatory input.) Any Transaction code where DATA.CAPTURE has been defined with 'Y' will be refused. Transaction codes with the DEBIT.CREDIT.IND = to 'CREDIT' will not be allowed.

CALC.TYPE

The method of calculation to be used for the associated currency. This field specifies whether separate calculations are to be made for each band of the base amount, whether only one is calculated which is dependent on the level of the base amount, or whether a Flat amount is to be applied. Example for FLAT, LEVEL and BAND: Assume a deal of Principal 100,000 USD where commission is calculated based on the Principal. The commission type record specifies an applicable rate of 2 per cent up to 10,000 and 1.5 percent over 10,000. If Band is specified for all sub value groups, 2 calculations will be performed, i.e. 2% on 10,000 1.5% on 90,000 If Level is specified for all sub value groups, 1 calculation will be performed, ie. 1.5% on 100,000 If Flat is specified, the basic Flat Amount will be applied. For LOT: To be used with derivatives trades which perform charge calculations on per lot basis. If Lot is specified, the Unit Charge will be applied per lot traded
Validation Rules
FLAT, LEVEL, BAND or LOT or any abbreviation thereof. (Mandatory Input.
CALCULATION.BASIS

Specifies whether the commission amount is to be calculated on a percentage basis, as a unit, or as a rate per lot basis. A unit charge can only be specified when using LEVEL or BAND calculation types. The amount entered in the UNIT.CHARGE field will applied for the corresponding amount in accordance with the BAND/LEVEL calculation type. A rate per lot charge can only be specified when using LOT calculation types. The value entered in the UNIT.CHARGE field will be applied for the corresponding amount per lot. This applies only for Derivatives trades.
Validation Rules
PERCENTAGE or UNIT or RATEPERLOT [Mandatory with CALC.TYPE of BAND or LEVEL or LOT, not allowed if CALC.TYPE is FLAT.
CATEGORY.ACCOUNT

Defines the Profit and Loss Category or internal Accounts to which the Commission should be credited. Normally the Commission being collected from the Customer is always in favour of the Bank and consequently a valid Profit and Loss category code should be entered. However, if for any reason, the bank is also acting as a collecting agent for a third party (e.g. Government), then an internal Account should instead be entered.
Validation Rules

4-5 numeric character Category code or 6-12 type SS (uppercase alpha or numeric, first character alpha) character local currency internal Account number or 3-10 type MNE (uppercase alpha or numeric or ".") character Account Mnemonic. (Mandatory input..
CCY.CONV.DEPENDENT

Determines whether the Commission Type is to be applied only when Foreign Exchange conversion is required. (Currency Conversion Dependent indicator). The presence of this field (only allowed value 'Y' for Yes) indicates that the derived commission amount is only to be applied when the associated Funds Transfer transaction entails a FX conversion (i.e. the Debit and Credit Currencies are different).
Validation Rules
Y(es) or blank. (Optional input.
CHARGE.PERIOD

Defines the number of months that comprise a charging period. A charge may be made periodically, e.g monthly, quarterly, etc. This field determines he length of time for which the commission type record applies. The period of the contract will be split in the number of periods defined in this field to calculate the total commission amount, for example a contract lasting one year, with CHARGE.PERIOD set to 3, would incur 4 times the defined commission amount, since the period has been defined as quarterly. The corresponding field MINIMUM.PERIOD can be used to specify the minimum number of periods to be considered. Note that this is currently utilised only by the Trade Finance system.
Validation Rules
1, 3, 6, 9, 12 or 24 Optional Inpu.

Defines the Overall Minimum Amount to be charged on transfers involving the Currency defined. This represents the minimum to be charged irrespective of any special conditions which could exist for a Customer or group of Customers except if these have been specified as a Flat amount. This amount could represent the actual cost to the bank of providing the service, which should never be waived.
Validation Rules

Up to 14 AMT type characters (standard amount format). Associated multivalue field. (Optional input.) It must be less than the Overall Maximum Amount. It must be less than or equal to the first Minimum Amount specified within a range for the currency. If Flat amount entered, then Overall Minimum Amount must not be greater than this value.

Identifies this Commission Type. When defining the Commission ID by means of an alpha key, the User must try to use meaningful codes to facilitate easy identification of the Commission Type. Examples could be: PM = Payment Commission EX = Exchange Commission The codes defined in this field are passed to Delivery as a suffix to the Commission code FTCOM. The combined code will be used within Delivery to provide meaningful text for credit/debit advices. Commissions can be linked together by using an ID in the format XXXXX.YYYYY. All codes with the prefix XXXXXX will be 'linked'. Consequently when ANY commission code with the prefix XXXXX is used all linked records will also be processed. This is primarily used for defining different commissions for resident and non-resident customers. e.g. Codes Amounts Residence/Non residence HC 5.00 resident *EEC HC.NEEC 10.00 non-resident *EEC When either HC or HC.NEEC is used both will be examined and the correct commission calculated based on the residence of the ordering customer. NOTE : A linked record cannot be input without a corresponding master record, i.e. XXXXX.YYYYY cannot exist without commission code XXXXX. Commissions can be entered for future dates by using an ID in the format XXXXX.YYYYY-YYYYMMDD. All codes with a suffix in the above date format separated by the delimiter '-' are for future commission changes. Only future dated existing commission types can be entered in the above format.
Validation Rules
11 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Mandatory input.)

Defines the Overall Maximum Amount to be charged on transfers involving the Currency defined. This amount represents the maximum to be charged irrespective of any special conditions which could exist for a Customer or group of Customers except if these have been specified as a Flat amount. This amount could represent the maximum amount the bank would ever conceivably charge a customer for a transfer regardless of the size of the Transfer Amount. Example : Let us suppose that "Wonder Bank" based in London applies the following payment commissions on incoming and outgoing funds transfers: 1) For any transfer in US Dollars (received or paid): - 2% for any amount up to USD 20,000.00 with a minimum of $50.00 and a maximum of $400.00. - 1% for any amount above USD 20,000.00 with a minimum of $400.00 and a maximum of $2,000.00. - An overall minimum of $50.00 and overall maximum of $2,000.00. 2) For transfers in any other currencies: - 1% for any amount up to GBP 10,000.00 equivalent with a minimum of 20.00 and a maximum of 100.00 - 1/4% for any amount above GBP 10,000.00 with a minimum of 100.00 and a maximum of 500.00. - An overall minimum of 20.00 and overall maximum of 500.00.
